metadata.title: CVE-2022-0854 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Compliant (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s DMA subsystem, in theway a user calls DMA_FROM_DEVICE. This flaw allows a local user to readrandom memory from the kernel space.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic-64k - 5.15.0-35.36
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required
